t: Proverbs 14
The*pn wise woman builds her house, but*ld with her own hands the foolish one tears hers down.
Whoever*pn fears the Lord*s walks uprightly, but*ld those who despise him are devious in their ways.
A*pn fool’s mouth lashes out with pride, but*ld the lips of the wise protect them.
Where*pn there are no oxen, the manger is empty, but*ld from the strength of an ox come abundant harvests.
An*pn honest witness does not deceive, but*ld a false witness pours out lies.
The*pn mocker seeks wisdom and finds none, but*ld knowledge comes easily to the discerning.
Stay*pn away from a fool, for*ld you will not find knowledge on their lips.
The*pn wisdom of the prudent is to give thought to their ways, but*ld the folly of fools is deception.
Fools*pn mock at making amends for sin, but*ld goodwill is found among the upright.
Each*pn heart knows its own bitterness, and*ld no one else can share its joy.
The*pn house of the wicked will be destroyed, but*ld the tent of the upright will flourish.
There*pn is a way that appears to be right, but*ld in the end it leads to death.
Even*pn in laughter the heart may ache, and*ld rejoicing may end in grief.
The*pn faithless will be fully repaid for their ways, and*ld the good rewarded for theirs.
The*pn simple believe anything, but*ld the prudent give thought to their steps.
The*pn wise fear the Lord*s and shun evil, but*ld a fool is hotheaded and yet feels secure.
A*pn quick-tempered person does foolish things, and*ld the one who devises evil schemes is hated.
The*pn simple inherit folly, but*ld the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
Evildoers*pn will bow down in the presence of the good, and*ld the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
The*pn poor are shunned even by their neighbors, but*ld the rich have many friends.
It*pn is a sin to despise one’s neighbor, but*ld blessed is the one who is kind to the needy.
Do*pn not those who plot evil go astray? But*ld those who plan what is good find love and faithfulness.
All*pn hard work brings a profit, but*ld mere talk leads only to poverty.
The*pn wealth of the wise is their crown, but*ld the folly of fools yields folly.
A*pn truthful witness saves lives, but*ld a false witness is deceitful.
Whoever*pn fears the Lord*s has a secure fortress, and*ld for their children it will be a refuge.
The*pn fear of the Lord*s is a fountain of life, turning*ld a person from the snares of death.
A*pn large population is a king’s glory, but*ld without subjects a prince is ruined.
Whoever*pn is patient has great understanding, but*ld one who is quick-tempered displays folly.
A*pn heart at peace gives life to the body, but*ld envy rots the bones.
Whoever*pn oppresses the poor shows contempt for their Maker, but*ld whoever is kind to the needy honors God.
When*pn calamity comes, the wicked are brought down, but*ld even in death the righteous seek refuge in God.
Wisdom*pn reposes in the heart of the discerning and*ld even among fools she lets herself be known.
Righteousness*pn exalts a nation, but*ld sin condemns any people.
A*pn king delights in a wise servant, but*ld a shameful servant arouses his fury.
